review.comments:
I been to carlton twice. I came back because the first time i went to carlton for normal staycay with my finaceè on her birthday m. I booked executive room. I totally forget to request for smoking room and upon check in it slip out of my mind to request also due to the stuning view at the lobby and 5 star reception service you guys provided. When when enter the room then i just remember about smoking room. I called the reception isit to late to request the smoking room ? They polite answer and get back to me. Next moment i received a bell that a bellboy came to ask are we ready to view the smoking room. I was suprise with the fast service. 
Then i recommend my friends about carlton and came back second time and thier review is the same as mine and they also feel like carlton is a best place to staycay and don’t mind coming back.

review.name: Daniial
review.comments:
Check-In Counter: it was good. Staff was prompt, warm hospitality.
Room: It was better than I expected. The only thing that is questionable is the temp regulator for hot and cold water. I wanted cold water but I kept getting hot water.
Staff: The staff here are very helpful. Housekeeping staff was good and quick at doing their work. They know what they are doing and always asked if I needed anything before they left. Very professional and passionate, good job! When I checked-out, the staff went person-to-person and helped us. It speeds up the check out process and I like it!
Location: Very convenient! Was near shopping malls and walking distance to Arab street (Cafe Lovers)!
View: i love it! Give me more city view! I can get use to it!

review.name: Silawan
review.comments:
I don’t like the attitude of the reception. The story is...
I stayed 3 nights and everything went well until checking out. I ordered breakfast for my last morning there and wanted to pay. It turned out that there was something else from the day before. I told the staff that I didn’t order in the bill but he insisted that is from my room. I told him, then please show me my signature of receiving that good. He could find it and spent more than 15 minutes of trying to call restaurant session. Once he realised that it took too much time already then he said “I can’t reach my colleague, so I will just charge you if I get a prove that you didn’t order that, I will call you and we will make a refund.” 
So I said “no, you just need to find that order paper that I wrote and sign, I won’t go back and forth for this amount of money. I won’t pay for taxi back and forth to settle the bill and get a refund of I didn’t order and eat. Then the person disappeared to another office for awhile and come back with new bill.
My breakfast cost a lot more than what he tried to charge me. Why he doesn’t believe the customer especially when he can’t find the evidence to show. Sadly it happened at last step, it ruined my feelings and the feeling toward Carlton hotel.

review.comments: There wasn't any bidet. Should have place plastic bags in the bin.

review.name: Germaine
review.comments:
Only could have 5 people in the two connecting rooms. This wasn't mentioned in booking,com when I booked. As a result, when six of us turned up, I had to ask one person to go home as the last person wasn't permitted
No social distancing was observed during check in on Saturday. Check in and check out queues were merged at the level 5 hotel reception area with many people as it was a public holiday. It may have been good for hotel to set aside time for check in and allow the people to check out later the following day as a form of compensation. Also waited 1hr to check in. 
In addition only 6 people allowed in pool at any one time. Pool was fully booked on both days as a result so we brought our swimsuits and towels for nothing.
No buffet due to Covid rules also. 
Only 3 coffee/ tea packets with 4 cups and saucers. Was a little spartan for the $700 I paid for one night, Also only 2 sets of body wash/ shampoo and conditioner. Considering there were 5 people who will bath once each day (so 10 showers in total).
No menu for room service.

Overall experience was great nonetheless.

review.comments:
Well appointed and spacious room. We had a view of the city but that was fine as it was a great view. We used the gym - it was very well equipped and the equipment was well maintained and looked new. Good range of machines and weights for use. The location is excellent - right next to Millenia Walk (lots of good dining options there, as well as a large supermarket and the Harvey Norman superstore) and just across the road from Marina Square (even more good dining and shopping options). A short walk will bring you to Marina Bay, Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands, Suntec City, etc. Gardens by the Bay is a little further away but easily accessible. Free parking available for those driving. 
Staff were friendly and helpful and seemed unperturbed by the crowd that was there during this school holiday break.

OK basically there's two issues which I think other Tenants would also bring up.
1) There is no bidget, which I think this is the most important part of the toilet, I've study the toilet layout, and I know to install the bidget would trouble by drilling holes and to lay new pipe. But what I would recommend is to upgrade to the toilet bowl bidget which would be much more easier.
2) Is the washing\drying machine, washing part no problem, but the drying part took more then 5hrs and it is still not dry. Expected our luggage to be light same during check in, but checking out with the damp clothes which really made a huge different, luggage become more heavier. I did check the dryer, and it need to be maintain. Need to clear all those dust which block the air flow. Due to the amount of dust, the dryer can't dry the clothes. Will need to clean everyday during housekeeping.

review.comments: There was a lapse during check in where i was requested to pay for 2 additional guests staying. Booking was made for 4 adults in 1 room, as confirmed on booking details as well. Upon check in, the above mentioned request was made at $60++ per person. I was informed by manager that 3rd party booking sites usually charge only for 2 persons(eventhough it was a room for 4 adults) I was further advised that in future to book direct via their own website. So i went ahead to confirm these details on their website which then showed the room details n pricing for 4 adults were exactly the same as paid on bookings.com. It clearly stated as well that price already included additional 2guests. Not to be a fuss but i would have paid 2x 60++ additional for no reason have i not probed further into the payment breakdown.

The rest of the crew were great too. Everyone is friendly and approachable. They really attend to u fast when u need assist from your hotel room.
Checking out was excellent. Fast, no hassle and i personally recommend W Hotel Singapore to everyone out there. You will Love W Hotel Singapore. Thank you W Hotel Singapore.❤

Also, the breakfast is so-so only, given the price of about 45 per adult, didn’t find it fantastic, however the staffs at the restaurant were the most welcoming!

Great room service from staff and food is good. One of the staff even brought my son balloons and a cake to celebrate his birthday - very thoughtful and made my son very happy :) Many choices restaurants right in front of the hotel too! Overall a memorable and pleasant stay!

review.comments:
The room is all about design but functionality is compromised. We stayed with our son in the Room with plunge pool as we wanted to enjoy to room. However there was a single chair in the room. So staying in the room was not possible unless you are in bed. The room had no table for dining in, they at least were very helpful in bringing some chairs from their conference room for dinning in. 
Also the furniture in the balcony is fancy but not comfortable. So we did not realy have a nice place to lounge close to the plunge pool. The furniture mattress also does not dry properly so it has a strange unpleasant smell. They should replace it by the very comfortable lounge chair they have around the pool. Also I would suggest that they take out the useless empty plant pot outside and place instead a table and 2 chairs close to the pool like they have in the other rooms. When you book such a room specially in these times you really want to enjoy it. If it was not for this our stay would have been perfect as the hotel rally delivers in all other aspects.

The CHECK-IN was SUPPOSED to be at 2PM. We reached at the hotel at 4plus and AND YET we STILL need to wait another nearly for AN-HOUR for the room to be ready. When the staff was being asked for it, they just responded it so cold. Its was a she btw. I think she the manager. But, im very please with 2 of the staff and knowing that i have a baby, they keep their best to update us on our room status. And the girl help to extend our check out time till 1pm.
On our last day, we asked whether if we can do a late check-out at around 3pm as we need a longer time to prep ourselves and and the baby. We understand that we couldn't do late check out but we just tried our luck with reason. The staff who was on the phone just hang up just after telling us that we couldn't It's just quite unpleasant. 
Understand that the hotel is full and all staff are very busy with end meets. But there's always a way to deal with all situations. Maybe u guys should do a retraining for all the managers there!
And maybe can do something for parking for whoever staying there. Its a killer!

The hotel staff told us there was no parking for motorcycles and was not very sure of the parking system for visitors. We rode in on our little scooter anyway and found out that parking for scooter was free and right next to the hotel lobby. Not sure if this was just a simple lapse in the staff knowledge or perhaps parking was something out of the hotel's control. 
The rooms did not provide shavers unless requested for, and there was no extra roll of toilet paper. The rain shower was great! but unfortunately every time we opened the glass door of the shower, the top of the glass door would scrap against the rain shower head. I honestly thought it was going to give way at some point. The seal for the shower door was not done very well/ had come loose so the toilet bowl area would get wet whenever we showered. 
Room can be a little dark at times even in the middle of the day, perhaps due to location of our room. Lights in the room were towards the yellow hue so its not the best place to get work done in.
Wifi was free but don't expect good continuous fast connection. Although I appreciated the nice touch of airplay and chromecast on their smart tv, the connection broke up a few times through one episode of 45mins so that was quite aggravating.
Had dinner one of the nights at Butterflies and Beast -- Ordered the Nasi goreng, half portion of pork knuckle and chicken claypot rice. The pork knuckle was good! Claypot rice is reasonable, and the nasi goreng was dismal (chicken wings tasted like it came out from macdonald's mcwings box, fried rice was blend and satay meat were very small dices of chicken. Acar was okay). You can get better claypot rice and nasi goreng in the nearby eateries in chinatown or kampung glam/bugis for a fraction of the price and double the happiness. I will not go back to BnB again although their service was good.

review.name: Hedy
review.comments:
Ventilation: could be improved? I could smell the fumes from cooking in other rooms in my room
The service I feel, though good and friendly, lacked true hospitality and warmth. I had to extend my stay from 3 to 4 weeks. I was told by reception that occupancy was very high, it was not possible to extend beyond 3 days, and a higher rack-rate would be charged per night. And that as there were also no other room types available I should look for solutions elsewhere
I subsequently found another (smaller) room in the same property on Booking.com. I was told by reception that as occupancy was high, that staff that I must check-out of the existing room at noon, and check-in for the new room again after 15:00. In between they could store my luggage
I understand and did not expect bend-over-backwards efforts to accommodate my extension. I fully understand I must vacate my room by noon to allow it to be cleaned and turned around for the next guest. I appreciate that I can only check in to my new room not before 15:00 as the room needs to be turned around after the last guest.
What is did not appreciate are the following:
(1) to be reminded 4 hours before I am due to vacate the room that I have to do so, and that my newly assigned room will not be available before 15:00, and that I should start to pack. Bearing in mind there has to be obviously a little tiny bit of buffer between me and the next guest because theoretically I could have extended my stay by 3 days
(2) the cold language (or what I perceive as cold)
These ‘services’ and experience made me feel like the most unwanted guest, that I am not welcomed at the Citadines Balestier.
My needs and demands were minimal during my stay. Beyond check-in, asking if there was a possibility to extend my stay, and check-out, I had not had to trouble the reception staff. My room was always kept tidy as a manner of respect to the housekeeping staff. I had no opportunity to use the other hotel facilities.

A bit far from everything, but perfect for my needs. 
Relatively close to some hospitals in the area. 
15 minutes or more to the subway (not a very pleasant walk, along a big road). Far from restaurants or shopping malls (15/20 minutes walk). 
Many local chinese restaurants along the main road, but hardly something tourists or business travellers could be interested on. Balestier is a place known for shops selling lights, lamps, bathroom fixture etc. Good if you need to go to hospitals, but still consider maybe taking a short trip with the bus

review.name: Cheryl
review.comments: On the last night, had a noise complaint and made sure to turn down the volume. Unfortunately it was still loud for the neighbours and 2 hotel staff came up to request to keep the noise level lower, which we gladly obliged and understood why. At this time, staff acknowledged that the noise was no longer an issue but he wanted our guests to leave immediately. We explained we had ordered food and both guests would leave once done, but was asked to give a specific timing. When we requested for time for food to arrive and to finish the meal (01:05-02:30), he said he would come back at 01:30 and then haggled for 02:00. I don’t quite understand the need to be so pushy especially when I had made it known that my guests were definitely not staying overnight and had only joined us for a birthday celebration. Extremely unnecessary and spoiled our last night’s stay. Definitely felt it could have been handled much better.

1. Restaurant staff at level 4 was a bit unfriendly. She failed to listen to our enquiry/ request 1st. All she wanted was to take our order. Resulting on 3 of our family of 5 allowed in for breakfast. We end up cancelling our breakfast.
2. Tried ordering room service. But our request was declines as restaurant cannot provide any room service at that time.

review.name: Alicia
review.comments:
The room could be cleaner and they could also provide a vanity kit (combs, cotton pads etc).
The picture of the room definitely seemed much bigger than the actual size.

review.name: Fizai
review.comments: The room above or beside us were making a lot of noise celebrating Christmas and I think they were drinking. Definitely their room was more than 5 ppl. What's worse is next day we came back to my key cards unable to read in the lift. After awhile it worked but then got stuck outside of my room. We called reception and they were asking series of questions and so on. One of it was if we had guests, our age and my name? Well ridiculous but I complied. I suspect the staff(s) thought we're the ones making the noises I think. As it make sense, cards not working and all of the questions. Then after the staff gave us our new working card, he waited outside for a minute before moving off. When we left our room in the afternoon, we did not request for room service though but our room was already made. Luckily we brought along most our valuables and belongings. 'Most' as my girlfriend left her laptop. So I guess it was just inappropriate to assume we're not of age when we gave our identity when checking-in and thinking we're the ones who made the noises when the real culprit gets away. And the air-con was not working I think as I've set it to the lowest but it doesn't seem to get cold. Not a negative feedback though, just letting you know what I experience as it's not my first time being here and would love to come back in near future.

review.name: Jalilah
review.comments:
The housekeeping is very poor. For my 3 days stay in there, they never clean the room and give toiletries. We have to call and request for the new toiletries.
But calling to clean the room, they never fulfilled at all.

name: Resort Amara Sanctuary Resort Sentosa (SG Clean, Staycation Approved)
location: 1 Larkhill Road, Sentosa, Sentosa Island, 099394 Singapore, Singapore

review.name: Anonymoue
review.comments: The Sketchers restaurant food is quite bad.

review.name: Danielle
review.comments: The hotel is shabby and could do with an injection of money to clean the place up. Lots of things were broken or not working properly. The room we were initially given had a whole window between the bedroom and bathroom covered in ripped gaffer tape, stained floors and just seemed dirty. There was a patio onto the garden which was nice but no chairs to sit on outside so I’m not sure what the point of it was. We were moved quickly to another room with a sea view which was great but the tv didn’t work, still no chairs on the balcony and lots of the fixtures were rusted and old. It was a shame as the location is great and it was peaceful and lovely, a good escape from the city.

review.name: Kehinde
review.comments: The breakfast was very basic: very limited options including no gluten-free options and no fruit.

review.name: Love
review.comments: The place got a lot of mosquitoes so the room also got. I hope you can look at it, Coz the place is very nice.

review.name: Muhammad
review.comments: The paint of the room looks old and the wooden pool platform was left much desired. Some of the platform wood are unsafe as there were nails jutting out near the jacuzzi.

review.name: Ahteeqah
review.comments: Staff was slightly cold. It was my birthday and when I jokingly asked if there is a free upgrade, there was a long silence and I told them I was joking. Facilities wise, there is any fork or spoon for a 5 stars hotel. The bed sheets had tears on them and the toilet bowl kept clogging and require a few times to flush. For its price, it's not worth it and there are better hotels. Separately, pool is also small and not monitored that even when we booked the pool, there were still a lot of people there.

review.name: Eric
review.comments: Nil

review.name: Xian
review.comments: Villa does not have Wi-Fi, too many mosquitos

review.name: Jiun
review.comments: The TV and air conditional quite old. Crack line appeared on the screen. Air conditioning hard to adjust to desired temperature

review.name: Ajeya
review.comments: bathroom could have been better

review.name: Hazimah
review.comments:
It is tiring to walk up the slopes to the hotel, especially after a long day of walking and riding in USS.
Shuttle bus mostly to harbourfront and certain timing to RWS. Would be good if the hotel could provide this information in the message after the booking. 
The spa was located quite far from the accommodation and is creepy at night. Should make the way more easier to find with newer signs or paths that are well lighted. Was walking around in circles asking me to take the lift but spa is at level 1.
There is no halal food so it is troublesome that we have to order food delivery when we are lazy to go out.

review.name: Khadijah
review.comments: There is a lot of mosquito when we are at the pool. Perhaps cn work on that.

review.name: Kkhai
review.comments: 2 things I didn't like was 1) the aircon in my room was faulty. The technicians did come to fix the problem. After awhile, the console would just prompt error then auto switch off. 2) the overhead lights near the bed kept flickering which bothered me

review.name: See
review.comments: Can provide more food and drinks options since its at Sentosa, it is not easy to get things easily.

- the furnitures looked dated

- surprisingly there's no teaspoons provided in the room to make your own tea/ coffee

review.name: Joel
review.comments: Room was dusty and furniture and cabinets definitely needs to be repaired. Floorboards were squeaky too. Not sure abt the bed sheets and quilts, and also the baby cot, but my boy came back with rashes on his eyebrows and back of his ears.. :(

review.name: Brenda
review.comments: A little but run down. In sufficient amount or attention from service staff. Called for buggy from villa to carpark but buggy did not appear after 15min. Walked out on my own after rain reduced to drizzle.

review.name: Liana
review.comments: It was abit dusty when we came in. The bed was not done neatly. I wished you had a contingency plan to cover the outdoor bed lounge in the couple suite when it rains instead of leaving it soaking wet with pools of water on it. We couldnt enjoy the outdoor day bed as it will take awhile to dry even though the rain stopped. And we wished there was halal food.

review.name: Vicky
review.comments: Swimming pool were too crowded sometimes, definitely exceeding safe distancing rule. Unsure if some family suites are occupied by more than 5 pax too as we observed many slippers or people on our floor on Saturday morning. Room furniture are aged with smell and mattress/pillow not as comfy as expected.

review.name: Jong
review.comments: Faciliries and furniture are rather old.

review.name: Cher
review.comments: The room looks abit tired and need some refurbishment

review.name: Imran
review.comments:
The villa bedroom lighting. Understand that the setting is suppose to be romantic but if we could have better control of the lights and change the brightness as we prefer would be great.
Neighbours can be heard quite easily for the villa.

review.name: Reene
review.comments: The resort needs touch up. Room exterior windows / building / elevators need a clean up. Carpet in elevators need a change. Shower head bathroom need a change (I can see grime around it) and the shower head holder is loose, I always need to adjust. Water stopper in bathtub is not working well, a lot water being drained off (my bubble bath bomb is wasted!), so I need to on the tap all the time. So Amara, imagine if all the guests left the tap on for 1 whole hour just to soak in the tub? The sun lounger / chairs at pool badly need a change to elevate the mood at the pool. Pillows looked fluffy, but became flat after I put my head on it, my neck was aching, but mattress is great.

review.name: Muhammad
review.comments: so much technical problem.. aircon not so strong, the telephone line problem not fix it.. jacuzzi pump problem , we start to use it less than 2 hrs before check out, and paid 500plus but all technical error

review.name: Tse
review.comments:
Throughout our 3d2n stay, the cable channels were down. 
Tried calling the reception a number of times but nobody picked up the phone.
Informed the reception about the cable channels and another issue. On both occasions, we were told they will get back to us but we didn’t get any follow up. I had to call again.
There were clumps of hair on the floor when we checked in.
The hotel may be overwhelmed by the surges in occupants during the December holiday. But I am certain they can do better. I have stayed there once before and the experience was much better.

review.name: Eileen
review.comments: None

review.name: Muhammad
review.comments: Location to the nearest monorail or bus stop needs to climb up or down the hill.

review.name: Dewi
review.comments: The buggie service tooked very long, since they Only have one buggy. So for check in it self need almost 45mnt to wait for the buggy. For the hotel with price 1K/night🤦🏽‍♀️. Seriously need to invest in more buggies.

review.name: N
review.comments: It's a very old room, with musty smell due to extremely high humidity in the room. It was very cold at night due to high humidity. The floor & wooden board around the room is visibly wet once I open the main door. The next door guests were very irresponsible for making noise past midnight till after 5+am!

review.name: Henry
review.comments: Location of the hotel.

review.name: Gps
review.comments: The furniture edges were rather sharp and my son got injured -coffee table, day bed frame, room bed frame. Breakfast was terrible everyday. Room service ended at 930pm so can't order food after that. Kids pool was littered with leaves and the pool bar and area were left deserted and completely unattended. Minibar was embarrassing. The TV always had issues - we couldn't access cable channels as sintel was out of service and the Internet on TV takes forever to load. Pls upgrade the TV already. Reception takes FOREVER to answer calls. Overseas standards are waaay better

review.name: Ismawati

review.name: Elenag

review.name: Ng
review.comments: The location

review.name: Marvin
review.comments: I thought that the distance to the beach was further than what was advertised on the site.

Arrived at restaurant for breakfast at 10.10am but was turned away citing that they closed at 1030am for breakfast. It seems they prefer to charge you full for in-room dining instead.
Baby cot are limited in quantity and took half a day to be provided.

I've been asking repeatedly for an invoice ( for claiming purpose) for a week for more than 5 times. and there has been no reply from booking,com or amara. 
I think we will book direct with property next time. if it is so hard to get an invoice.

review.name: Jeslyn

review.name: Ts
review.comments: I enquired if the hotel sells cake for my son birthday before our check in, the enquiry was sent via Booking.com messaging system. But there wasn't any response.

review.name: Aidil
review.comments:
Jacuzzi water too cold
Unable to adjust

review.name: Tee
review.comments: Price.

review.name: Aisya
review.comments:
1. The private swimming pool water was dirty (very milky). 
2. The water heater was terrible. Hot/Warm water was only available for maximum of 10mins before it turns cold back. 
3. Alot of insects in the outdoor area which wont be safe for kids (Big Ants and other weird insects). We had to close both rooms door all the times as we’re afraid that the insects will enter the room, which it did!
4. The outdoor area was dark at night, we used the torchlight provided in order to go to the other room. 
5. Lastly, they do not have any smoking room available.

review.name: Redentor
review.comments: They didn't have a lot of vegan food options

review.name: Zue
review.comments: We called for the breakfast room service 3 times, no one answered, so have to call the reception to order, but the reception forgot to submit our request, 1 hour later, still no sign of breakfast, then call the reception again, reception ask the kitchen to call me , kitchen asked me do I still want the order? they can get it done in 15 mins times. so they did. i not sure is due to under staff.. but i will never order breakfast in anymore.. And when we ask the staff, is there nearby cafe or restaurant, staff does not even know the surrounding area, asking us to go to RWS area for cafe/ restaurant, which is about 15mins away by train.. in the end we found out, there is a cozy restaurant area, just less than 5 mins walk away from Amara..

review.name: Kris
review.comments: Nice, natural location.

review.name: Sln
review.comments:
not worth for the price. Property too old... 
Last, I did hi light it was celebrate my friend 40th birthday and hotel agreed provide us a cake but we did not receive.

review.name: Eileen
review.comments: I’m not sure if we were walking the correct way back to our room, could do with more lights along the way as it was rather dark. Also, we could have walked through the carpark (shorter way out & brighter) but we couldn’t access the gate even with our room cards.

review.name: Kek
review.comments: Not convenient especially when raining season. I got 2 rooms, not in the same building, quite a part away

review.name: Rosalind
review.comments: chicken burger at Shutters was very oily

review.name: Natalie
review.comments: The ala carte buffet- we were there on a weekday morning around 8. They seemed understaffed and orders took really long to arrive. They looked overwhelmed. Staff did not tell us that the orders are kept to the number of pax at table. We have to finish before ordering again.

review.name: Vincent
review.comments: The staff does not offer to help us with our luggage and we have to carry them for quite a distance to our suite room. The buggy service is a bit long to wait. A long walk to the room itself if you don't use the buggy car from the hotel. Route to walk back to room during night time is hard as there are no lights provided along the walkway. Breakfast was quite expensive at S$40++ with limited food option.

review.name: Seema
review.comments: I have stayed at this hotel 10yrs ago so in comparison, the room does look a little aged. Service staff seem to be limited too with us having to wait longer than usual to get someone from reception or in-room dining on the phone.

review.name: Terence
review.comments: Motr choices of food.

review.name: Adrien
review.comments:
-They try to enforce the usage of a chatbot as opposed to the classic call to concierge, it needs working, couldn't even order fresh towels and concierge ended up calling to confirm what we needed.
-The rooms with Jacuzzi are in old buildings (which is part of the charm) but maintenance is low. The AC leaked and made the floor slippery (my son felt before going to bed, that's how we realized) and we had the engineering team coming in at 10pm to vacuum the excess condensation in the system, it was extremely noisy and not particularly clean operation. We filled a formal complaints during our checkout the next day but as of writing of this feedback (7 days later) we haven't heard back! Given the water infiltration marks this is clearly not a new issue (at least in the room we got) and for the price we paid we would have expected better.

review.name: Abdul
review.comments:
The toilet has no bidet or maybe I didn’t requested fr it.
The breakfast ala carte buffet tastes good but it’s ala carte buffet and you can only choose one from main course. If you choose english breakfast, u cant get nasi lemak or other main course. Pity us we weren’t informed. So the word buffet is questionable haha😅

review.name: Wiwitlynn
review.comments: The toilet was filled with sands all over and the restaurant did not welcome us even after we stood on side there waiting to be serve for about 15mins long. 😔

review.name: Pmelayu
review.comments: There was a bit of wear and tear in the Deluxe rooms and there was no bidet in the bathroom.

review.name: Voon
review.comments: Bathroom shower drainage little smelly.

review.name: Loh
review.comments:
- The location of the resort is not very convenient, you have to walk all the way to the main road to take the shuttle bus to RWS or other attractions.
- It is not stroller friendly, I stayed at the couple suite which is at the very back of the resort. There is no slope or proper pavement to push the stroller from the main lobby to our stay.
- The main lobby is not that accessible if you drive in. Unless you drive and drop off at the main lobby, else after you parked your car, you have to push and carry your loads to take a lift and then push upslope to the main lobby.
- Always under staff. There is no one to help you open the main lobby door when you enter or leave. I thought that’s the normal service most hotel provide.
- For morning breakfast, only a few staffs able to serve you.

review.name: Lixia
review.comments:
The colonial house are very unique . However the interiors are a bit run down . Time to change the wooden cupboards and the bathroom doors. 
Room service takes a bit of time . The staff service are good.

review.name: Nuruljannah
review.comments: The deluxe room had no view whatsoever. I was expecting there to be some sort of view, however simple but it just ended up being a view of the back of the hotel.

review.name: Dev
review.comments:
We stayed at the Fullerton Singapore for my partner's birthday. We arrived to the exquisite colonial atmosphere of the beautiful hotel and were warmly escorted to a room of equal splendour. There were balloons and a slice of cake with compliments from the hotel. Throughout our stay, we were snugly looked after by all of the hotel staff. We would like to personally thank the Fullerton's Duty Manager during our stay, Justin. He definitely put our comfort and satisfaction as a top priority. His professionalism and hospitality made our stay at the Fullerton a truly memorable experience. 
One of the highlights of our stay is the iconic view of the Singapore skyline from our room, mainly made possible by the Fullerton's impeccable location.
Nevertheless, it is the warmness and the little surprises offered by the staff during our stay that won our hearts!

review.name: Low
review.comments:
I felt the quality of the food could be better. We tried the chef's platter and the sirloin steak at Mr Stork. The platter's fried karaage chicken and tempura prawns tasted exactly the same - like batter. The steak was a tad too dry and salty even though we had asked for medium doneness. Great views at Mr Stork though, and again very friendly wait staff. 
Breakfast was so-so. My partner had the laksa which lacked the usual richness from the coconut broth you would expect from the dish, so it ended up just tasting like chili soup. I had the eggs benedict, which I have no complaints about. But with so many choices around the hotel, it's probably a better option to explore those instead.

I forgot the name of the guy who helped us sort our issue. I was looking for him on our check out but he was off duty. Thanks a million. The staff friendly, warm, professional, always looking how to make our stay great. 
The location is also great! In the middle and close of everything.
The food, omg delicious! I must add and would like to give a shout out to the Ash & Elm staff. They asked about my food restrictions, had substitutes for everything meaning has gluten free+dairy free options. We had the striploin and tenderloin, absolutely delicious! Honestly, just that made my eating experience beyond!! Thank you so much

Hotel breakfast was not worth it. Very few choices and rushed feeling due to safe distancing. Food wasn't exactly fantastic and both days were the same.
We asked room service for ice and they said it would be $5! Never had to pay for ice in any other 5 star hotel before. 
Pool system was a bit weird. We can't book in advance and have to walk in. BUT if we go down and it's full, then we can stand by for slots. So it is like a wasted trip down as pool is nearly always full. Rather we call in and book a slot in advance and go down for it.
Will be good if hotel entertainment can be updated and include streaming services on smart TVs (Netflix amazon prime etc) as the TV channels selection is quite dismal.
Hotel is not exactly 🧒-friendly which is not necessarily a bad thing but parents would def appreciate gestures such as toiletries for kids, kids play kit (esp at breakfast). Even the cot came without linen (we had to ask for it).

review.name: F
review.comments:
I checked-in during weekends and the process was smooth, less than 30 minutes as they did batch by batch according to guests's check-in timing .
All staffs from concierge and counter were nice and helpful and followed SOP and well as making sure guests followed SOP when entering the hotel and waiting turn for check-in .
Stayed here before but this time decided to try the Signature suite . Wow, the suite was lovely !
Loved the small walk-in wardrobe that was connected to the bathroom 😍
The bathroom had both shower and bathtub and the whole bathroom were spacious ! Loved it 
The bedroom was comfy . The suite was really clean and comfy and the deco were also nice !
Complimentary mineral bottles and tea and such as well as toiletries .
The swimming pool open early morning and we went at around 8am(limited to 1 hour per room) .
It was great and the staff who managed the pool counter was nice too .
Cold storage was just minutes away and that was so convenient for us .
Overall its really an enjoyable stay for us .
Thumbs up to you guys, OHS ! 👍❤

review.name: Sara
review.comments: I would say breakfast was a no-brainer. Super basic as due to covid, you have to place your request for breakfast via an order sheet - and I feel it’s a lot for the staffs to handle. Firstly, you still get the orders messed up. Taste was as well not there. So, my advise, if you are booking a staycation, forget about the breakfast because you can have way better outside hotel premise.

review.name: Ber
review.comments:
The air con was not cold... The response time from the call centre/receptionist is slow. First, we requested for bath robe, and have to call second time after 5-10mins of waiting before they send up. 
Secondly when aircon wasn't cold and had to call 3 times (with about 5-10mins interval) before the technician appear... Worst, took him about 15-20 mins before he told us that unable to fix and we have to change room. Again, had to wait for another 15mins or so before our room is ready... And it was past midnight.... The whole duration from reporting till telling us unable to fix took more than an hour...
Pillow is very hard... Too compact and we both can't sleep well... 
Water flow for bathtub is quite slow and low, even turn max.

Not the quiet I was looking for.

review.name: Sien
review.comments: ala cart breakfast suppose to be buffet

review.name: Tri
review.comments:
The hotel is very nice, clean, staff very friendly and polite, large and nice rooms. The breakfast at the restaurant is very good. Thank you to the service team. I would like to suggest a little bit that the pool should have more white umbrellas to decorate and romantic.
I was a little surprised that in Vietnam, all 4 - 5 star hotels have welcome drinking water upon check-in, and the reception area is always full of tables and chairs for guests, particularly Singapore I have In some hotels, there is no welcome drink even though I booked a high-class room and the reception area was very few seats, guests just stood in check in and then went to the room, perhaps culturally different from each other. reasonable? But I find the way hotels in Vietnam make it easier for them to feel good.
Thank you

review.name: Catherine
review.comments:
Booking through Booking.com always makes me having issues upon checking in. The staff was rude and due to the last minute booking, the system did not have the information and the process was too long. 
Will visit again to try the breakfast as we forgot to choose the room that include breakfast and the Hotel Receptionist, Mr Kenta did not allow us to make the changes even before we made the payment.

review.name: Gayle
review.comments: Excellent Hotel in very good location. Walk to shops, restaurants and bars. Very helpful, friendly staff. Club room facilities excellent. Food excellent. Will be back!
